meanings.definition: To accustom (a child or young animal) to food other than its mother's milk.
meanings.sent1: The mother cow will wean her calf off milk and onto grass.
meanings.sent2: It is important to wean puppies onto solid food gradually.
meanings.sent3: The baby bird tried to wean itself onto worms instead of relying on its mother's regurgitated meals.
meanings.sent4: She decided to wean herself off sugary snacks and onto healthier options.
meanings.sent5: The zookeeper had to wean the baby panda off bottle feeding and onto bamboo shoots.

meanings.definition: To detach from a source of dependence.
meanings.sent1: He needed to wean himself off his addiction to video games.
meanings.sent2: The goal is to wean the country off fossil fuels and onto renewable energy sources.
meanings.sent3: She tried to wean her cat off sleeping on her lap all day.
meanings.sent4: The company had to wean itself off government subsidies and become self-sustainable.
meanings.sent5: It's challenging to wean oneself off social media addiction in today's digital age.
